headline: Fed’s Clarida Highlights Risks to Economic Growth From Abroad
summary: Financial-market signals about slowing economic growth should be one of several indicators that inform monetary policy judgments, Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Richard Clarida said Monday in Dallas.

headline: Cardinal George Pell Found Guilty of Sexually Assaulting Choirboys
summary: The most senior Vatican official to ever stand trial on child sex-abuse charges was found guilty of assaulting two choirboys at a church in his former diocese.

headline: Manafort’s Lawyers Ask Judge for Leniency

headline: Bernie Sanders Says He Plans to Release 10 Years of Tax Returns

headline: Evolving Venezuela Sanctions Pose Problems for Banks

headline: GOP’s ‘Born Alive’ Abortion Bill Fails to Advance in Senate
summary: Republican-written legislation that would force health-care practitioners to provide medical care to infants deemed alive after abortion procedures fell short of the votes needed to advance in the Senate, failing to overcome Democratic opposition.

headline: Etsy Stock Rises, as Users and Sellers Grow
summary: Etsy’s sales and profits beat Wall Street projections in the most recent quarter, and the online marketplace forecast another year of strong growth, sending shares up in extended trading.

headline: Shake Shack Revenue Rises, Helped by Higher Prices
summary: Shake Shack Inc.’s revenue climbed 29% in its latest quarter, boosted by higher prices and new locations.

summary: Anything can happen when Trump and Kim get together again.

summary: The GOP freshman joins the left in trashing Neomi Rao.

summary: God may be great, but for Riyadh’s temporal purposes, Xi Jinping apparently is greater.

headline: A Nobel Prize for Trump

summary: The current expansion may soon be America’s longest, and neither inflation nor tariffs are likely to stop it.

summary: He no longer stands out now that Democrats have all embraced his ideas.

summary: A coal plant produces about as much toxic waste in an hour as a nuclear plant produces in a year.

headline: Patients Face Monthslong Waits for New York Specialists

headline: Syria’s Assad Visits Tehran, Looking to Cement Ties

headline: Trump Budget Proposal Would Protect Military From Steep Spending Cuts

headline: Vandalism of Brooklyn Church’s Statue Called a Hate Crime

headline: U.K. Labour Party Would Back Second Brexit Referendum

summary: The Trump administration imposed sanctions on allies of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and urged regional governments to isolate his regime, but played down the prospects for military intervention.

summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission says in a court filing that a Feb. 19 tweet regarding projected production volumes in 2019 violated terms of a prior settlement.

summary: Barrick Gold said it has proposed an all-share merger with Newmont Mining, a move that could create a mining giant that would be valued at around $42 billion.

summary: Investigators in Texas searched Sunday for cockpit voice and data recorders in the wreckage of a cargo plane flying for Amazon.com Inc. that crashed this weekend, killing the three people on board.

summary: Warren Buffett said Berkshire Hathaway and Brazilian private-equity firm 3G Capital overpaid in 2015 when they helped Heinz buy Kraft to form Kraft Heinz, but he has no plans to sell.

headline: Who’s Deplorable Now?
summary: Democrats wonder if they still need the Midwest.

headline: The Season’s Secret Ingredient: Maple Syrup
summary: At this sugar shack in rural Quebec, maple syrup brings a certain je ne sais quoi to every rustic, riotous meal. Bring the feast home with these deeply comforting recipes.

summary: Executives for some of the biggest drug companies will visit Capitol Hill to face tough questions in a Senate hearing on the rising cost of medicines as Americans continue to grapple with the rising cost of health care.

summary: Audiences have more choices than ever before. For Hollywood, that might not be a good thing.

headline: The New Look of North Korea’s Economy: ‘It’s All Capitalism There Now’
summary: Indicators show day-to-day commerce in the country has remained resilient, rice prices are stable and gasoline prices have eased. There are even signs of growing entrepreneurialism in markets that carry domestically made goods.

headline: Marine Recruits Learn an Important Lesson: What Happened on 9/11
summary: The U.S. war in Afghanistan has been going on for so long that the newest recruits weren’t alive when it started. In boot camp, they’re taught about the terrorist attacks that set off the war they may soon fight.

headline: After Brazil Tragedy, Mining Firms Call for New Oversight of Waste Dams
summary: Large mining companies are calling for an independent, global body to monitor the risks posed by waste dams, as the industry scrambles to react to the collapse of a Brazilian dam that left at least 171 dead.

headline: Activist Investor Claims Insurer Wastes Money on CEO’s Lifestyle

headline: Vietnam Is Big Enough for Only One Kim Jong Un
summary: Kim Jong Un impersonator Howard Lee looks a little too much like the North Korean leader—so Vietnamese authorities sent him and his baggy black suits packing.

summary: With “Late Night Feelings,” award–winning producer Mark Ronson—fresh off an Oscar win for “Shallow”—has released his most personal album yet.

headline: Avocados and Olives Cost More Because Fat Is In Fashion
summary: Farmers around the globe are struggling to keep up with an increasing global appetite for fats that are perceived as healthy, leading to long-term disruptions in food prices.

headline: Europe Seeks Out New Frontiers in Space Race
summary: Six small prototype satellites slated for launch this week amount to a light payload with weighty significance: a new vision for Europe’s troubled space programs.

headline: ‘Green Book’ Wins Best Picture at the Academy Awards
summary: The race-relations drama “Green Book” won the Oscar for best picture, an unexpected choice in a year in which many thought the award might go for the first time to a Netflix movie or superhero blockbuster.
